messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> You should keep in mind that Junit is meant to be a *unit*
> testing framework, not a panacea.

Oh trust me, I am well aware of that :-)

It's good to see that you are as well, and the fact that JUnit is only a
unit-testing framework is what prompted me to create TestNG in the first
place.

Unfortunately, many people are using JUnit for more than unit testing, and
some of JUnit's design decisions (such as not maintaining state between
method invocations and not supporting dependent test methods) make it really
hard to use JUnit for integration or acceptance testing. Akhil's problem is
clearly not a unit-testing problem and I'm afraid JUnit is not a good match
in this particular case.

For tests that do more than verifying the code within one class, I find it
more intuitive to be able to set the state in one method and having this
state available in another method:

// TestNG code

private ConnectionPool m_connectionPool = null;

// Invoked once before tests on this class start running
@Test
public void initConnection() {
m_connectionPool = ...; // create connection pool
}

@Test(dependsOnMethod = { "init.*" })
public void insertAddress(String name) {
// reuse m_connectionPool and insert into the database
}
